Class DashboardViewController

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.ryandorman.simplescheduler.controller.DashboardViewController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class DashboardViewController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Handles the controller logic associated with creating data reports and displaying them on the Dashboard.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Initializes the controller. Configures the charts and table displaying the reports and load the initial data to report on.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - Location used to resolve relative paths
        resourceBundle - null

      • onDateFilter

        public void onDateFilter()
        Handles new date filter input and updates view.

      • setupDatePickers

        private void setupDatePickers()
        Sets date filter inputs to default to start and end of current year.

      • setupAggregationComboBox

        private void setupAggregationComboBox()
        Sets Customer Appointments aggregation combo box to display options: Type. Month, Type by Month. Updates the Customer Appointments BarChart on selection. A Lambda is used to increase readability and simplify access to the javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener interface.

      • setupContactComboBox

        private void setupContactComboBox()
        Sets Contact Schedule combo box to display Contacts as options. Updates the Contact schedule currently displayed in the view on selection. Lambdas increase readability of the data mapping from contacts to combo boxes, and they simplify access to the javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener interface.

      • setupScheduleTableView

        private void setupScheduleTableView()
        Sets up the Contact Schedule table so it can display the appropriate Appointment data.

      • populateCustomerAppointments

        private void populateCustomerAppointments()
        Reads the Customer Appointment aggregation category and populates the BarChart with the correct data.

      • getCustomerAppointmentsByType

        private java.util.List<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Number>> getCustomerAppointmentsByType()
        Transforms the Appointment data into a map of aggregated counts for each Appointment type and sets the counts into BarChart series. Streams and lambdas are used to increase ease and readability of data transformations.
        Returns:
        List of data series containing the Appointment type counts to set in the BarChart

      • getCustomerAppointmentsByMonth

        private java.util.List<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Number>> getCustomerAppointmentsByMonth()
        Transforms the Appointment data into a map of aggregated counts for each Appointment month and sets the counts into BarChart series. Streams and lambdas are used to increase ease and readability of data transformations.
        Returns:
        List of data series containing the Appointment month counts to set in the BarChart

      • getCustomerAppointmentsByTypeAndMonth

        private java.util.List<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Number>> getCustomerAppointmentsByTypeAndMonth()
        Transforms the Appointment data into a map of aggregated counts for each Appointment month and type combination and sets the counts into BarChart series for each type by month. Streams and lambdas are used to increase ease and readability of data transformations.
        Returns:
        List of data series containing the Appointment month counts to set in the BarChart

      • populateUserWorkload

        private void populateUserWorkload​(java.time.ZonedDateTime startDate,
                                  java.time.ZonedDateTime endDate)
        Uses the Dashboard's date range to populate the LineChart with time series data. Handles Transformation of Appointment data into a map of counts for each user Appointment per month-year in the date range. The counts are displayed in the User Workload LineChart. Streams and lambdas allow for easy map construction and simplify the flow of data transformations.
        Parameters:
        startDate - Start date range of time series
        endDate - End date range of time series

      • getChartUpperBounds

        private long getChartUpperBounds​(java.util.List<javafx.scene.chart.XYChart.Series<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Number>> seriesList)
        Calculates the upper bounds to use on a chart's y-axis based on the data to be displayed in the chart. Streams and lambdas allow for quick exploration of the nested seriesList data structure to assess the max range of the data.
        Parameters:
        seriesList - List of all series to be displayed in chart
        Returns:
        Number to set as the charts upper bound

      • populateContactSchedule

        private void populateContactSchedule()
        Reads the Contact Schedule combo box and populates the Table with the correct data.

      • loadAppointmentsInWindow

        private void loadAppointmentsInWindow​(java.time.ZonedDateTime start,
                                      java.time.ZonedDateTime end)
        Loads Appointment data for the date range specified replacing all existing data.
        Parameters:
        start - Start of Appointment date range
        end - End of Appointment date range
